txt.en:
'Duty done, again,
to rest at last
I yearn.

'So too my brother,
wandering by night.
A spirit lost
brings naught but fright.

'Provide this ring,
show him it is done.

'Then we rest
'neath Moon and Sun.'

'Shining and gleaming,
I hath seen this before
on hand of my kin
as death pulled him forth.

'In the stone alcove,
where life ebbed away,
we had hid treasure
and summoned forth death.

'Now shall I rest,
as my brother the same.
At last at peace,
at last to dream.

'Seek the black rock....'

'Our duty done, brother,
hear the call of slumber.
Know at last peace,
rest, interred again eternal.'

'My brother,
our curse,
we wander in death
until the Bones
are set to rest.'
The Wandering Shade in the Barrow-downs asked you to deliver the ring you collected to its brother's tomb in Bree.
Deliver the ring to the shade in Bree-town

The Wandering Shade's brother now wanders through the streets of Bree. If the sun is shining, the shade may be summoned by troubling its tomb; at night, search the alleys for the shade.\n\nA tomb rests somewhere in Bree, and a shade leaves its confines at night to haunt the streets. The Wandering Shade wishes for you to bring his ring to his brother.
